# make_tooltip { #turtle_island.make_tooltip }

```python
make_tooltip(
    label,
    tooltip,
    text_decoration_style='dotted',
    color='blue',
    *,
    name='tooltip',
)
```

Returns a Polars expression that generates an HTML tooltip for each row.

::: {.callout-tip}
# Credit: gt-extras
This function is heavily inspired by the [gt-extras](https://github.com/posit-dev/gt-extras) package.
:::

## Parameters {.doc-section .doc-section-parameters}

<code>[**label**]{.parameter-name} [:]{.parameter-annotation-sep} [str]{.parameter-annotation}</code>

:   Column name containing the main text to display.

<code>[**tooltip**]{.parameter-name} [:]{.parameter-annotation-sep} [str]{.parameter-annotation}</code>

:   Column name containing containing the text shown when hovering over the label.

<code>[**text_decoration_style**]{.parameter-name} [:]{.parameter-annotation-sep} [Literal\[\'solid\', \'dotted\', \'none\'\]]{.parameter-annotation} [ = ]{.parameter-default-sep} [\'dotted\']{.parameter-default}</code>

:   A string indicating the style of underline decoration. Options are `"solid"`, `"dotted"`, or `"none"`.

<code>[**color**]{.parameter-name} [:]{.parameter-annotation-sep} [str \| Literal\[\'none\'\]]{.parameter-annotation} [ = ]{.parameter-default-sep} [\'blue\']{.parameter-default}</code>

:   A string indicating the text color. If "none", no color styling is applied.

<code>[**name**]{.parameter-name} [:]{.parameter-annotation-sep} [str]{.parameter-annotation} [ = ]{.parameter-default-sep} [\'tooltip\']{.parameter-default}</code>

:   The name of the resulting column. Defaults to "tooltip".

## Returns {.doc-section .doc-section-returns}

<code>[]{.parameter-name} [:]{.parameter-annotation-sep} [pl.Expr]{.parameter-annotation}</code>

:   A Polars expression that creates an HTML string with tooltip functionality.

## Examples {.doc-section .doc-section-examples}

```{python}
import polars as pl
import turtle_island as ti

pl.Config.set_fmt_str_lengths(200)
df = pl.DataFrame(
    {
        "name": ["Turtle Island"],
        "description": ["A Utility Kit for Polars Expressions"],
    }
)
new_df = df.with_columns(ti.make_tooltip("name", "description"))
new_df
```

new_df.style
